title: Kog'Maw's Graph is the Opposite of a Hypercarry

embed.description: LoL Statistics, Builds, Runes, Masteries, Skill Orders, Counters and Matchups for Kog'Maw when played ADC. Statistics include Kog'Maw's Win Rate, Play Rate and Ban Rate. Counters include who Kog'Maw ADC is Strong or Weak Against.

body: He has a 58% winrate in the first 25 minutes and that drops to 53% by 40+. Moving AS to W is a mistake that just made him too strong early while doing nothing for his AP variant. By comparison, look at a normal[ hypercarry graph from Vayne](http://champion.gg/champion/Vayne). 41.9% winrate in the first 25 minutes and 56.4% winrate at 40+. That's the way Kog'Maw is supposed to look too.

You didn't build him like blue Ez.  You built him for tons of raw AD, good OnHit, and decent attack speed.  The AD was amplified by his W's ratio, making each basic attack hurt quite a bit more while the lower attack speed meant that Kog could actually get some degree of mileage out of kiting.  Because his Ult also scaled with bonus AD, that meant you were vaporizing anything under half HP while having Mura to give you a decent mana pool.

Thing is, Triforce, BoRK, and IE are three of the most expensive items in the game, at 3800, 3400, and 3600 respectively. 

Rageblade is 2800. The other 3 zeal upgrades are 2600. Wits end is 2800 and nashors is 3k. The pen items are all 2700 or less.

This is also why the incoming base AS nerf is TOTALLY the right direction, if you want to turn him back into a hyper carry: he'll scale worse with AS, so it'll make more sense to buy AD on him, pushing his power curve back to hyper scaling.

Anyways, I think the overall point that OP is trying to make is that the rework and recent changes were not good for Kog'maw.

He was always supposed to be a hyper-carry. The rework itself had the idea of giving him loads of attack speed to deal insane on-hit damage and instantly blow up any enemy as long as his team protects him from being CC'd or 100-0'd. To be successful he would still need to be a part of a protect-the-kog'maw comp.

Except he's received so large of a buff that he's now a lane bully. He's hitting his late-game damage spike at level 9 thanks to everything being on his W. His damage is sufficiently high that it doesn't matter if he doesn't have protection - he can 100-0 the enemy ADC before the enemy assassin can 100-0 him. Sometimes he can 100-0 both? He's still weak to CC which is keeping him under a 90% win rate thankfully, but he's really overtuned right now. He was over 50% win rate before his latest buff - there was no reason for it...
